author: Alok Deshpande
text:
Shiv Sena, NCP slam RSS; MNS warns of attacks on those who speak about breaking Maharashtra; BJP says it is Vaidya's personal opinion

Maharashtra’s Advocate General Shreehari Aney on Tuesday submitted his resignation to Governor C Vidyasagar Rao, two days after he demanded separate statehood for Marathwada, which evoked a sharp rebuke from the opposition as well as the Shiv Sena.

“Shooting the messenger does not solve the problem,” Mr. Aney said in a statement on Facebook. “In the present disruption of the legislature, I see a clear pattern. Since I shall not stop from voicing my demand for Vidarbha’s statehood, the legislators will not stop from using it as a ready excuse to stall the working of the house; one of us has to step back.”

Mr. Aney said the Advocate General’s prime function is to protect the interest of the people. “And that the legislature must function if the interest of the people is to be protected, my final act as Advocate General which would be most in the interest of the people of the state was to resign from the post.”
title: Maharashtra Advocate General Aney resigns
